{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3537828,"name":"Nicollas","username":"Nicollas","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/59ef9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T12:45:05.201Z","cooked":"

Hello, our team wants to use the Through Bore Encoder from REV, but we don’t have the REV 11-1881 adapter. We would like to know if there is another way to connect the encoder to the Data Port of the SPARK without the adapter.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T12:45:05.201Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":58,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":315.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492931,"topic_slug":"alternative-connection-for-rev-through-bore-encoder-without-adapter","display_username":"Nicollas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/alternative-connection-for-rev-through-bore-encoder-without-adapter/492931/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3537923,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T14:47:17.286Z","cooked":"

Most likely, you’d want to use a different REV adapter: rev-11-3326. You only need to connect three wires – power, ground, and Absolute Duty Cycle, so you can make your own. But, you need the parts to do this. If you don’t have the parts, you may as well order the REV adaptor. If you want to make your own, you should be able to find instructions by searching CD.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T14:47:17.286Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":27.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492931,"topic_slug":"alternative-connection-for-rev-through-bore-encoder-without-adapter","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-3326/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Absolute Encoder Adapter - REV Robotics","clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/alternative-connection-for-rev-through-bore-encoder-without-adapter/492931/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3537960,"name":"Nicollas","username":"Nicollas","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/59ef9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T15:00:54.728Z","cooked":"

Got it. Would there be any solution other than connecting it to the data port? Our team thought about connecting two Sparks one to the NEO and another to the Through Bore Encodee to receive the information separately. Do you know if that would work?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T15:00:54.728Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":44.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492931,"topic_slug":"alternative-connection-for-rev-through-bore-encoder-without-adapter","display_username":"Nicollas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14283,"username":"nuttle","name":"Allen Nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/alternative-connection-for-rev-through-bore-encoder-without-adapter/492931/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3537963,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T15:03:19.470Z","cooked":"

It would probably be easier to connect the encoder to the roborio in that case.

Nicollas:

we don’t have the REV 11-1881 adapter. We would like to know if there is another way to connect the encoder to the Data Port of the SPARK without the adapter.

Buy these and cut them in half.
